intro: Eupatorium glechonophyllum, commonly known as the white eupatorium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically aromatic foliage. The plant features tall, slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy white to pale purple flowers appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eupatorium glechonophyllum is often found in moist, sunny habitats like swamps and along stream banks.
